newsitem.title: USA: KEDO tenders to buy residual fuel for June, July.
newsitem.headline: KEDO tenders to buy residual fuel for June, July.

text.p: The Korean Peninsula Energy Development Organization on Thursday issued a tender to buy a total of about 150,000 tonnes of residual fuel for June and July.
The tender, which closes on May 28 at 1400 GMT, is for 88,000 tonnes of fuel oil for delivery to Nampo/Songrim and 62,000 tonnes to Sonbong, North Korea.
Bids should be for loadings of 20,000-53,000 tonnes each for June 4-15, June 16-30, July 1-15 and July 16-31, KEDO's broker in Washington, International Services Corp, said.
Or, for Nampo/Songrim, bids may be made CIF for deliveries of two 22,000 tonne cargoes during June 4-25, and two 22,000 tonne cargoes during July 7-28.
KEDO, an international organization established to implement nuclear non-proliferation in North Korea, has agreed to supply the country with 500,000 tonnes of fuel oil annually.
